entry.title: How to prepare & deliver a talk
entry.content:
• Nothing to do with your English. (?)

Structure: how to organize your talk

  • A single thesis statement
    • Everything supports your thesis
  • Make your talk prefix-competitive
  • Put your results up front
  • Say what you did, why you did it, but not how you did it
  • Give your results multiple times at different levels/granularities
  • Begin a talk: explain your title
  • Show scholarship
    • how does your work fit into the rest of the world? (Solved an important open problem)
  • Go deep rather than board
  • How to prepare: explain your talk to others
  • View your talk as a tree traversal

How your slides should look like

  • slide deck/slides should be self contained
  • slide should have a point and a conclusion
  • nearly every slide should have a picture/example
  • the last slide should convey what you want people to see at the end

Hint to Deliver Your Talk

  • Keeping people’s attention
  • People only pay attention to one thing at a time
  • Looking at people’s faces. Stand by the screen, point and touch the screen.
  • Conclude your slide
  • Tell personal stories (be careful)
  • Smile
  • Should you read your slides?
    • Should be a super set
  • Tell a joke
    • commit to your joke yourself
    • explain it the way that audience know when to laugh
  • Don’t apologize

How to present graphs

  • Explain axes (mention units)
  • Mention which way is good
  • Explain meanings
entry.summary:
• Nothing to do with your English. (?)

Structure: how to organize your talk

  • A single thesis statement
    • Everything supports your thesis
  • Make your talk prefix-competitive
  • Put your results up front
  • Say what you did, why you did it, but not how you did it
  • Give your results multiple times at different levels/granularities

entry.title: 十年
entry.content:
距离那场考试已经整整十年了。依稀还记得些奇怪的细节：考试后的细雨；特地找到某个考室却还是没确定里面坐的那位是否是多年不见的一位朋友，反而差点迟到了数学考试；语文 的作文题“初中●高中“；午饭的鱼头；去往考场的长长的阶梯；当然还有年少轻狂的自己。

那时候一起去考试的小伙伴们，都已渐渐没了联系。留在记忆里的，只剩下一串串名字和一张张稚气面孔。初中的往事大多已模糊，却还有些无法忘记的画面惹人感慨。正如现在每次 踏上学校新建的人工草场时，都仿佛闻到了十年前第一次比赛时福州大学里草场一模一样的味道。

还记得初中入学测试我帮忙出语文卷子却考得让人哭笑不得；

还记得晚自习之后在家一边看天下足球一边写周记；

还记得02年火热的世界杯之夏好多小伙伴加入了足球阵营；

还记得自习课上谈笑风声被班主任拐弯抹角却巧妙地不留情面当众斥责；

还记得和晓蓓、林晟为了一点小事笑了整整一晚的自习；

还记得数学课上没理由地突然放声大笑搞得老师一脸怒气然后过了几分钟淡定地上黑板解题；

还记得收到的匿名情书看着就是个恶作剧却还是心存感激；

还记得踢球的小伙伴们和土场上挥洒过的汗水；也还记得我们的talking time。。。

只是那时一起经历过这些的朋友，大概再也没有机会一起回忆这些了。

细细想来，初中大概是我过的最后的真正无忧无虑最单纯的日子了吧。回想起来这段日子总是觉得快乐的，不像忆起高中总是希望小心翼翼地绕过不愿提及的种种遗憾。或许真的简单 就是美好吧。
entry.summary:
距离那场考试已经整整十年了。依稀还记得些奇怪的细节：考试后的细雨；特地找到某个考室却还是没确定里面坐的那位是否是多年不见的一位朋友，反而差点迟到了数学考试；语文 的作文题“初中●高中“；午饭的鱼头；去往考场的长长的阶梯；当然还有年少轻狂的自己。

那时候一起去考试的小伙伴们，都已渐渐没了联系。留在记忆里的，只剩下一串串名字和一张张稚气面孔。初中的往事大多已模糊，却还有些无法忘记的画面惹人感慨。正如现在每次 踏上学校新建的人工草场时，都仿佛闻到了十年前第一次比赛时福州大学里草场一模一样的味道。

还记得初中入学测试我帮忙出语文卷子却考得让人哭笑不得；

还记得晚自习之后在家一边看天下足球一边写周记；

entry.title: Setting up Hadoop (fedora-linux)
entry.content:
Choose your way of installation

There are actually two ways of installing Hadoop:

  • Download source code and compile it;
  • Download distribution and use it.

The problem of the 2nd approach is that the pre-compiled distribution is a 32-bit version, and it generates a warning every time a command is executed when running on a 64-bit machine. But generally you would get into much more troubles if you try to compile from the source code. So here we use the 2nd approach and just ignore the warnings. The distribution can be downloaded from hadoop's website. In case you want to access API docs in an IDE such as eclipse, you can also download the source code and attach it to appropriate packages.

Hadoop 2.2.0 installation

Installing Hadoop in a standalone mode is trivial, while installing in a fully-distributed mode requires several machines. Here we consider the procedure of installing in a pseudo-distributed mode, which basically follows the instructions from the official document.

  1. Configuration

    Edit etc/hadoop/core-site.xml:

    Edit etc/hadoop/hdfs-site.xml:

  2. Setup ssh connection without password

    Edit /etc/ssh/sshd_config: change PasswordAuthentication to no

  3. Setup the environment

    You can edit etc/hadoop/hadoop-env.sh, but here we choose to modify ~/.bashrc and add the following lines:

    The JAVA_HOME for Fedora (JDK version 1.7.0) is something like /usr/lib/jvm/java-1.7.0-openjdk-1.7.0.60-2.4.5.1.fc20.x86_64.

    Don't forget to source ~/.bashrc after editing.

  4. Execution and testing

    (1). Format the filesystem:

    (2). Start namenode and datanode:

    (3). You can browse the web interface at http://localhost:50070 by default.

    (4). Run some examples (see Hadoop docs for details).

Hadoop in Eclipse

There are several ways of integrating Hadoop into Eclipse. We again choose the easiest one: hadoop eclipse plugin. You can build from the source or use the release version if you are working on Hadoop 2.2.0 and Eclipse Kepler. Then you can simply create a new Map/Reduce Project in Eclipse, add a Map/Reduce Location, and run examples such as WordCount. By default, the input and output files locate on local filesystem. Modify the configuration as follows to run it on HDFS:

By default, your_hdfs_location is hdfs://localhost:9000.
entry.summary:
Choose your way of installation

There are actually two ways of installing Hadoop:

  • Download source code and compile it;
  • Download distribution and use it.

The problem of the 2nd approach is that the pre-compiled distribution is a 32-bit version, and it generates a warning every time a command is executed when running on a 64-bit machine. But generally you would get into much more troubles if you try to compile from the source code. So here we use the 2nd approach and just ignore the warnings. The distribution can be downloaded from hadoop's website. In case you want to access API docs in an IDE such as eclipse, you can also download the source code and attach it to appropriate packages.

entry.title: Don't forget how to hexo
entry.content:
Hexo

  1. Writing

  2. Generating

  1. Deployment

Or deploy after generating

Markdown

  • "#"s: captions
  • " "and" * ": italic and bold
  • " * "," + ", " - " or "1,2,3...": lists
  • " ```language ": code
  • " ' code ' ": inline code
  • "Tags" and "Catagories"
  • " \$ " and " $$ ": latex math
  • "[text](link)": hyperlink
  • ">": text reference
entry.summary:
Hexo

  1. Writing

  2. Generating

entry.title: Tips for Setting up Fedora
entry.content:
For Thunderbird:

The server for my current mail in CS is mail.cs.stonybrook.edu for both imap and smpt. Ports are 993 and 587. Types of security are SSL/TLS and STARTTLS. Settings are the same for the university mail except that the servers becomes smtp|imag.gmail.com. Don't forget to use full address for the user name.

For cude:

Remember the -override compiler option when running the run file. RPM installation doesn't work for me very well since it replaces the current driver without asking me.

A list of packages(software):

  • matlab
  • nvidia driver
  • chrome
  • kile
  • thunderbird
  • vim-enhanced
  • icedtea
  • rpm-fusion
  • dropbox
  • gcc-c++
  • fcitx & im-chooser
  • node.js & hexo
entry.summary:
For Thunderbird:

The server for my current mail in CS is mail.cs.stonybrook.edu for both imap and smpt. Ports are 993 and 587. Types of security are SSL/TLS and STARTTLS. Settings are the same for the university mail except that the servers becomes smtp|imag.gmail.com. Don't forget to use full address for the user name.

entry.title: Install Nvidia driver on Linux(fedora)
entry.content:
Since Nouveau is typically used by default, the first thing to do after you download the driver from Nvidia is to disable Nouveau. This can be done by adding the following line to /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist.conf

However, you may have the Nouveau driver worked into your root filesystem (initramfs), which happens in the current version of fedora. So you would like to remove this:

Also, don't forget to install some necessary packages including gcc, kernel-devel and kernel-headers.

After reboot and kill the X server by init 3, you should be able to run the run file (Nvidia driver).
entry.summary:
